com.ctrlaltelite.pos.gui

Class ManageEmployeeController

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ctrlaltelite.pos.gui.ManageEmployeeController

  • public class ManageEmployeeController
extends Object
    The ManageEmployeeController class provides the logic for managing employees in the POS system. It allows adding, updating, and displaying employee information in a TableView and handles interaction with the database for saving and updating employee records.

    This controller interacts with JavaFX components such as TableView, TextFields, and Buttons, and allows for in-place editing of employee data within the table.

    Dependencies: - com.ctrlaltelite.pos.models.Employee - com.ctrlaltelite.pos.utils.SceneManager - com.ctrlaltelite.pos.database.DatabaseConnection FXML Annotations: - @FXML: Identifies fields and methods to be linked with FXML elements in the associated view file.

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        public void initialize()
        Initializes the controller, sets up the TableView columns, loads employee data from the database, and sets up field population and editing capabilities.

      • handleAddEmployee

        private void handleAddEmployee()
        Sets up edit commit handlers for the columns in the TableView. These handlers capture edits made to individual cells in the TableView and update the corresponding Employee object.

      • handleSaveChanges

        private void handleSaveChanges()
        Handles the action of saving changes made to the employee data. This method iterates through the list of employees and determines whether to insert a new employee (if the employee ID is 0) or update an existing one. It attempts to insert or update all employees and tracks whether the operations are successful. If all changes are saved successfully, a success alert is shown; otherwise, an error alert is displayed. After the changes are processed, the employee data is reloaded and the TableView is refreshed to reflect the latest changes. This method does not take any input parameters, as it is typically triggered by a UI event (such as clicking a "Save Changes" button).

      • handleLogout

        private void handleLogout()
        Handles logging out by switching to the login scene.

      • exitFrame

        private void exitFrame(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
        Handles the event when the user chooses to exit the current frame or window. This method is triggered by an ActionEvent (such as clicking a button) and attempts to switch the scene to the "ManagerLanding.fxml" view, which corresponds to the Manager Landing page. If an exception occurs while switching scenes, it is caught, and the stack trace is printed for debugging.
        Parameters:
        event - The ActionEvent triggered by the user, such as clicking the exit button.

      • loadEmployeeData

        private void loadEmployeeData()
        Loads employee data from the database and populates the TableView with the data.

      • insertEmployee

        private boolean insertEmployee(Employee employee)
        Inserts a new employee record into the database. The method uses a prepared statement to insert the employee's details into the `employees` table. If the provided date is not in the correct format (yyyy-MM-dd), an IllegalArgumentException is caught, and an error alert is shown to the user.
        Parameters:
        employee - The Employee object containing the details to be inserted. This includes first name, last name, role, hire date, pay rate, and status.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the employee was successfully inserted into the database; otherwise, returns false if an error occurred.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the provided hire date is not in the valid format.

      • updateEmployee

        private boolean updateEmployee(Employee employee)
        Updates an existing employee record in the database. The method uses a prepared statement to update the employee's details in the `employees` table. If the provided date is not in the correct format (yyyy-MM-dd), an IllegalArgumentException is caught, and an error alert is shown to the user.
        Parameters:
        employee - The Employee object containing the updated details, including the employee ID, first name, last name, role, hire date, pay rate, and status.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the employee details were successfully updated in the database; otherwise, returns false if an error occurred.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the provided hire date is not in the valid format.

      • clearFields

        private void clearFields()
        Clears all input fields in the form.

      • populateFields

        private void populateFields(Employee employee)
        Populates the form fields with the data from the selected employee.
        Parameters:
        employee - the employee to populate the fields with

      • showAlert

        private void showAlert(String title,
                       String message,
                       javafx.scene.control.Alert.AlertType alertType)
        Displays an alert dialog with the given title, message, and alert type.
        Parameters:
        title - the title of the alert
        message - the message to display in the alert
        alertType - the type of alert (information, error, etc.)
